security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown files. No executable code, no network calls, no file writes, no external command execution. Guides AI assistants on browser automation workflows without implementing any capabilities.

content.user_title: Discover documentation pages with browser automation
content.value_statement: Static tools like curl fail on JavaScript-rendered sites. This skill provides a decision tree for detecting when browser automation is needed and guides you through using the best available browser tool for documentation discovery.
actual_capabilities: Detects when browser automation is required vs static fetching
Identifies available browser tools (Antigravity, Cursor, Playwright)
Provides decision tree for selecting the right browser tool
Returns structured data with discovered pages and navigation structure
limitations: Does not contain browser automation code itself - only guidance
Requires external browser tools to be installed and configured
Cannot execute JavaScript or navigate pages directly
Depends on Chrome debugging port or IDE-specific tools

use_cases.title: Scrape JS-rendered docs
use_cases.description: Extract documentation from modern sites that use React, Next.js, or Vue frameworks that block static fetching

use_cases.title: Automate browser decisions
use_cases.description: Help AI assistants determine when browser automation is needed and which tool to use based on environment

use_cases.title: Build doc site maps
use_cases.description: Automatically discover and catalog all pages in a documentation site with proper navigation structure

prompt_templates.title: Basic discovery
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to extract documentation from a website. Use browser-discovery to determine if browser automation is needed and which tool to use.

prompt_templates.title: Full site crawl
prompt_templates.prompt: Discover all documentation pages on https://example.dev. Start with browser-detection to check if curl works, then use the appropriate browser tool to extract all pages and navigation structure.

prompt_templates.title: Fallback handling
prompt_templates.prompt: Check for available browser automation tools. If none are available, provide setup instructions for Chrome debugging or suggest alternatives.

prompt_templates.title: Production workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a pipeline that: 1) Tries curl first, 2) Detects browser tools, 3) Uses Playwright wrapper via MCP for JS-rendered sites, 4) Returns structured JSON with all discovered pages and nav hierarchy.

output_examples.input: I need to extract documentation from a Next.js site that blocks curl
output: Detected: Curl returned <1KB with JavaScript warnings - browser automation required
Available tools: Playwright MCP via Chrome debugging on localhost:9222
Navigation structure: Sidebar with 6 top-level sections

best_practices: Always try curl first before invoking browser automation - it is faster and cheaper
Use accessibility snapshots instead of screenshots for link extraction (structured data vs visual)
Close browser sessions when done to prevent resource leaks
anti_patterns: Using browser automation when curl would return complete content
Skipping tool detection and assuming a specific browser tool exists
Taking screenshots when structured accessibility data would be more useful
Navigating without waiting for JavaScript to render

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Each tool has different browser capabilities available.

faq.question: What are the limits of browser automation?
faq.answer: Browser automation is slower and more resource-intensive than curl. It requires external tools like Chrome, Playwright, or IDE support.

faq.question: How does this integrate with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Claude Code can launch Chrome with debugging port 9222, then use the Playwright MCP wrapper for on-demand browser access.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using browser tools?
faq.answer: Browser sessions run in isolated profiles. Each task gets fresh state. No cookies persist between tasks by default.

faq.question: Why does curl fail on some sites?
faq.answer: Modern sites use JavaScript frameworks (React, Next.js, Vue) to render content. Curl only downloads HTML without executing JavaScript.

faq.question: How is this different from regular web scraping?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on documentation discovery with structured output. It prioritizes accessibility trees over screenshots for parseable results.
